help: Usage: # alignment help # just for alignment help [COMMAND] Options:
h: Usage: # alignment help # just for alignment help [COMMAND] Options:
trace: Usage: # alignment trace # just for alignment trace [LEVEL] t [LEVEL] Options:
t: Usage: # alignment trace # just for alignment trace [LEVEL] t [LEVEL] Options:
verbose: Usage: # alignment verbose # just for alignment verbose [LEVEL] v [LEVEL] Options:
v: Usage: # alignment verbose # just for alignment verbose [LEVEL] v [LEVEL] Options:
pwd: Usage: # alignment pwd Options: # alignment Type "help rpwd" for the remote analogous.
ls: Usage: # alignment ls # just for alignment ls [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size # alignment Type "help rls" for the remote analogous.
tree: Usage: # alignment tree # just for alignment tree [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -d, --depth maximum display depth of tree -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size # alignment Type "help rtree" for the remote analogous.
find: Usage: # alignment find # just for alignment find [OPTION]... [DIR] f [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -i, --insensitive make filename filtering case insensitive -l show more details -n, --name filter by filename -r, --regex filter by filename using regular expression -t, --type filter by file type # alignment Type "help rfind" for the remote analogous.
f: Usage: # alignment find # just for alignment find [OPTION]... [DIR] f [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -i, --insensitive make filename filtering case insensitive -l show more details -n, --name filter by filename -r, --regex filter by filename using regular expression -t, --type filter by file type # alignment Type "help rfind" for the remote analogous.
du: Usage: # alignment du # just for alignment du FILE Options: # alignment -h, --human print size in human readable format (e.g. 17K) # alignment Type "help rdu" for the remote analogous.
cd: Usage: # alignment cd # just for alignment cd [DIR] Options: # alignment Type "help rcd" for the remote analogous.
mkdir: Usage: # alignment mkdir # just for alignment mkdir DIR Options: # alignment Type "help rmkdir" for the remote analogous.
cp: Usage: # alignment cp # just for alignment cp SOURCE DEST cp SOURCE... DIR Options: # alignment Type "help rcp" for the remote analogous.
mv: Usage: # alignment mv # just for alignment mv SOURCE DEST mv SOURCE... DIR Options: # alignment Type "help rmv" for the remote analogous.
rm: Usage: # alignment rm # just for alignment rm [FILE]... Options: # alignment Type "help rrm" for the remote analogous.
exec: Usage: # alignment exec # just for alignment exec COMMAND : COMMAND : COMMAND Options: # alignment Type "help rexec" for the remote analogous.
:: Usage: # alignment exec # just for alignment exec COMMAND : COMMAND : COMMAND Options: # alignment Type "help rexec" for the remote analogous.
shell: Usage: # alignment shell # just for alignment shell sh Options: # alignment Type "help rshell" for the remote analogous.
sh: Usage: # alignment shell # just for alignment shell sh Options: # alignment Type "help rshell" for the remote analogous.
rpwd: Usage: # alignment rpwd Options: # alignment Type "help pwd" for the local analogous.
rls: Usage: # alignment rls # just for alignment rls [OPTION]... [DIR] rls [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size # alignment Type "help ls" for the local analogous.
rtree: Usage: # alignment rtree # just for alignment rtree [OPTION]... [DIR] rtree [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -d, --depth maximum display depth of tree -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size # alignment Type "help tree" for the local analogous.
rfind: Usage: # alignment rfind # just for alignment rfind [OPTION]... [DIR] rf [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -i, --insensitive make filename filtering case insensitive -l show more details -n, --name filter by filename -r, --regex filter by filename using regular expression -t, --type filter by file type # alignment Type "help find" for the local analogous.
rf: Usage: # alignment rfind # just for alignment rfind [OPTION]... [DIR] rf [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -i, --insensitive make filename filtering case insensitive -l show more details -n, --name filter by filename -r, --regex filter by filename using regular expression -t, --type filter by file type # alignment Type "help find" for the local analogous.
rdu: Usage: # alignment rdu # just for alignment rdu [FILE] Options: # alignment -h, --human print size in human readable format (e.g. 17K) # alignment Type "help du" for the remote analogous.
rcd: Usage: # alignment rcd # just for alignment rcd [DIR] Options: # alignment Type "help cd" for the local analogous.
rmkdir: Usage: # alignment rmkdir # just for alignment rmkdir DIR rmkdir [SHARING_LOCATION] DIR Options: # alignment Type "help mkdir" for the local analogous.
rcp: Usage: # alignment rcp # just for alignment rcp SOURCE DEST rcp SOURCE... DIR rcp [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE DEST rcp [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE... DIR Options: # alignment Type "help cp" for the local analogous.
rmv: Usage: # alignment rmv # just for alignment rmv SOURCE DEST rmv SOURCE... DIR rmv [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE DEST rmv [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE... DIR Options: # alignment Type "help mv" for the local analogous.
rrm: Usage: # alignment rrm # just for alignment rrm [FILE]... rrm [SHARING_LOCATION] [FILE]... Options: # alignment Type "help rm" for the local analogous.
rexec: Usage: # alignment rexec # just for alignment rexec COMMAND :: COMMAND ::COMMAND rexec [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND :: [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND ::[SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND Options: # alignment Type "help exec" for the local analogous.
::: Usage: # alignment rexec # just for alignment rexec COMMAND :: COMMAND ::COMMAND rexec [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND :: [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND ::[SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND Options: # alignment Type "help exec" for the local analogous.
rshell: Usage: # alignment rshell # just for alignment rshell rsh Options: # alignment Type "help shell" for the local analogous.
rsh: Usage: # alignment rshell # just for alignment rshell rsh Options: # alignment Type "help shell" for the local analogous.
scan: Usage: # alignment scan # just for alignment scan [OPTION]... s [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -L show more details of both servers and sharings -l show more details of sharings
s: Usage: # alignment scan # just for alignment scan [OPTION]... s [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -L show more details of both servers and sharings -l show more details of sharings
connect: Usage: # alignment connect # just for alignment connect SERVER_LOCATION Options: # alignment disconnect>, open
c: Usage: # alignment connect # just for alignment connect SERVER_LOCATION Options: # alignment disconnect>, open
open: Usage: # alignment open # just for alignment open SHARING_LOCATION o SHARING_LOCATION Options: # alignment close>, connect
o: Usage: # alignment open # just for alignment open SHARING_LOCATION o SHARING_LOCATION Options: # alignment close>, connect
get: Usage: # alignment get # just for alignment get [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... get [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -h, --no-hidden doesn't copy hidden files -N, --overwrite-newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --overwrite-no never overwrite files -p, --preview do not transfer, just show a preview of what will happen -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -S, --overwrite-diff-size overwrite files only if size is different -s, --sync synchronize (same as -N but remove old files) -y, --overwrite-yes always overwrite files # alignment open, put
g: Usage: # alignment get # just for alignment get [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... get [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -h, --no-hidden doesn't copy hidden files -N, --overwrite-newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --overwrite-no never overwrite files -p, --preview do not transfer, just show a preview of what will happen -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -S, --overwrite-diff-size overwrite files only if size is different -s, --sync synchronize (same as -N but remove old files) -y, --overwrite-yes always overwrite files # alignment open, put
put: Usage: # alignment put # just for alignment put [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... put [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -h, --no-hidden doesn't copy hidden files -N, --overwrite-newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --overwrite-no never overwrite files -p, --preview do not transfer, just show a preview of what will happen -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -S, --overwrite-diff-size overwrite files only if size is different -s, --sync synchronize (same as -N but remove old files) -y, --overwrite-yes always overwrite files # alignment open, get
p: Usage: # alignment put # just for alignment put [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... put [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -h, --no-hidden doesn't copy hidden files -N, --overwrite-newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --overwrite-no never overwrite files -p, --preview do not transfer, just show a preview of what will happen -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -S, --overwrite-diff-size overwrite files only if size is different -s, --sync synchronize (same as -N but remove old files) -y, --overwrite-yes always overwrite files # alignment open, get
list: Usage: # alignment list # just for alignment list [OPTION]... list [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -l show more details of sharings
info: Usage: # alignment info # just for alignment info [OPTION]... i [OPTION]... info [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... i [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -l show more details of sharings
i: Usage: # alignment info # just for alignment info [OPTION]... i [OPTION]... info [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... i [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -l show more details of sharings
ping: Usage: # alignment ping # just for alignment ping [OPTION]... ping [OPTION]... [SERVER_LOCATION] Options: # alignment -c, --count stop after count messages
es: Usage: # alignment es # just for alignment es [OPTION]... [COMMAND [COMMAND_OPTIONS]] Options: # alignment -d, --discover-port port used for broadcast discovery messages -h, --help show this help --no-color don't print ANSI escape characters -t, --trace <0_or_1> enable/disable tracing -v, --verbose set verbosity level -V, --version show the easyshare version -w, --discover-wait time to wait for discovery responses # alignment SEE THE MAN PAGE FOR MORE INFO AND EXAMPLES
esd:
Usage: # alignment esd # just for alignment esd [OPTION]... [SHARING [SHARING_NAME] [SHARING_OPTION]...] Options: # alignment -a, --address
server address (default is primary interface) -c, --config load settings from a server configuration file -d, --discover-port port used to listen to discovery messages; 1 disables discovery (default is 12021) -e, --rexec enable rexec (remote execution) -h, --help show this help -n, --name server name (default is server hostname) --no-color don't print ANSI escape characters -P, --password server password, plain or hashed with es-tools -p, --port server port (default is 12020) -s, --sharing <[sh_name]> <[sh_options]> sharing to serve --ssl-cert path to an SSL certificate --ssl-privkey path to an SSL private key -t, --trace <0_or_1> enable/disable tracing -v, --verbose set verbosity level -V, --version show the easyshare version # alignment SEE THE MAN PAGE FOR MORE INFO AND EXAMPLES
es-tools: Usage: # alignment es-tools # just for alignment es-tools [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -c, --generate-config generate default esd.conf file -h, --help show this help -p, --hash-password generate an hash of the password -V, --version show the easyshare version # alignment SEE THE MAN PAGE FOR MORE INFO AND EXAMPLES
usage: Type es --help for see es usage and options. Type help command for the full documentation of a command. Available commands are: help show this help exit, quit, q exit from the interactive shell trace, t enable/disable packet tracing verbose, v change verbosity level scan, s scan the network for easyshare servers connect, c connect to a remote server disconnect disconnect from a remote server open, o open a remote sharing (eventually discovering it) close close the remote sharing get, g get files and directories from the remote sharing put, p put files and directories in the remote sharing pwd show the name of current local working directory ls list local directory content l alias for ls -la tree list local directory contents in a tree-like format cd change local working directory mkdir create a local directory cp copy files and directories locally mv move files and directories locally rm remove files and directories locally find search for local files exec, : execute an arbitrary command locally shell, sh start a local shell rpwd show the name of current remote working directory rls list remote directory content rl alias for rls -la rtree list remote directory contents in a tree-like format rcd change remote working directory rmkdir create a remote directory rcp copy files and directories remotely rmv move files and directories remotely rrm remove files and directories remotely rfind search for local files rexec, :: execute an arbitrary command remotely rshell, rsh start a remote shell info, i show information about the remote server list list the sharings of the remote server ping test the connection with the remote server
